article: I am used to taking a bus home, but last night it was _ and I decided to ride in a taxi. I stood on the side-walk _ to each car that passed. I _ each one to _ , but none would. Then I _ that it was the time of day when one group of taxi drivers stopped and another began work. I began to wish that I hadn't had the idea of taking a _ . I was all wet. I took off my hat to pour _ the water that had collected in the brim . At that moment, a taxi stopped in front of me and the driver said something that I didn't _ . I quickly jumped in and sat down. "Where do you want to go ?" he asked me. I gave him my _ . "That's uptown , sir," he said. "I'm _ duty now. I was just to _ you up if you were going my _ . " _ this time it was raining harder. Cars were stopped behind the taxi. Their knocking horns were beginning to _ that we move. I _ I had known what to do! I felt like insisting that the taxi driver _ me home. But at the same time, I knew that I _ have gotten into the taxi without understanding what the driver had said to me. Two more blasts from somebody's horn made the driver demand that I make up my mind. I got out, although I didn't want to.
